unnormalised: **Telecoms Embrace OTT Partnerships for Growth in India**
normalised: **Telecoms Embrace O T T Partnerships for Growth in India**

unnormalised: New Delhi, October 26, 2023 – Indian telecommunications providers are increasingly forging strategic partnerships with Over-the-Top (OTT) platforms to enhance their service offerings and bolster subscriber retention in a competitive market. This trend, mirroring global developments, aims to bundle entertainment and connectivity, providing customers with a seamless digital experience.
normalised: New Delhi, twenty sixth October two thousand and twenty three – Indian telecommunications providers are increasingly forging strategic partnerships with Over-the-Top (O T T) platforms to enhance their service offerings and bolster subscriber retention in a competitive market. This trend, mirroring global developments, aims to bundle entertainment and connectivity, providing customers with a seamless digital experience.

unnormalised: Bharti Airtel recently announced an extended collaboration with Eros Now, offering bundled subscriptions to its mobile and broadband customers. Reliance Jio, not to be left behind, is reportedly in advanced discussions with Hotstar and Zee5, building on existing partnerships.
normalised: Bharti Airtel recently announced an extended collaboration with Eros Now, offering bundled subscriptions to its mobile and broadband customers. Reliance Jio, not to be left behind, is reportedly in advanced discussions with Hotstar and Zee five, building on existing partnerships.

unnormalised: Analysts at IIM Ahmedabad suggest these collaborations are vital for telcos to differentiate themselves beyond mere data provision. The move echoes a "Om Shanti Om"-esque strategy, striving to offer users "everything, everywhere, all at once."
normalised: Analysts at I I M Ahmedabad suggest these collaborations are vital for telcos to differentiate themselves beyond mere data provision. The move echoes a "Om Shanti Om"-esque strategy, striving to offer users "everything, everywhere, all at once."

unnormalised: Industry experts predict this trend will intensify, with smaller players like Vodafone Idea needing to follow suit to remain competitive. Bundling plans with OTT platforms offers value-added services, allowing consumers to enjoy content consumption without worrying about separate subscriptions. It is expected that this will increase data consumption rates and generate higher revenue for the telecom operators.
